description: Enterprise techniques used by Hi-Zor, ATT&CK software S0087 (v1.2)
name: Hi-Zor (S0087)

techniques.comment: [Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) communicates with its C2 server over HTTPS.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) creates a Registry Run key to establish persistence.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) has the ability to create a reverse shell.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) encrypts C2 traffic with a double XOR using two distinct single-byte keys.(Citation: Fidelis Hi-Zor)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) encrypts C2 traffic with TLS.(Citation: Fidelis Hi-Zor)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) deletes its RAT installer file as it executes its DLL payload file.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) has the ability to upload and download files from its C2 server.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) uses various XOR techniques to obfuscate its components.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)

[Hi-Zor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0087) executes using regsvr32.exe called from the [Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1547/001) persistence mechanism.(Citation: Fidelis INOCNATION)
